name: Path M Prostate
title: Pathologic M
rows:
Note: M1 has subcategories of M1a, M1b and M1c. Assign M1 only when there is no information available to assign one of the subcategories

Distant metastasis, NOS 

Stated as M1 [NOS]

Distant lymph node(s):
    Aortic, NOS:
        Lateral (lumbar)
        Para-aortic
        Periaortic
   Cervical
   Common iliac
    Inguinal, NOS:
        Deep, NOS:
            Node of Cloquet or Rosenmuller  (highest deep inguinal)
        Superficial (femoral)
    Retroperitoneal, NOS
    Scalene (inferior deep cervical)
    Supraclavicular (transverse cervical)
    Distant lymph node(s), NOS

Stated as M1a

Metastasis in bone(s) WITH or WITHOUT distant lymph node(s)

Stated as M1b

Distant metastasis, other than distant lymph nodes or bone(s)

Carcinomatosis

Distant metastasis WITH or WITHOUT distant lymph nodes and/or bone(s)

Stated as M1c

Pathologic M is not defined for this site/histology
In situ (no Tis defined)

There is no evidence of metastatic disease (cM0)
There is no pathologic workup for metastatic disease
Negative biopsy of a distant site
Clinical evidence of metastatic disease (clinical M1) but not histologically proven
